summary: This is an email chain from March 17, 2020, regarding the sharing of privilege search terms used by a taint team to review Jeffrey Epstein's electronic evidence. The terms were provided by Epstein's attorneys before his suicide and are being used to filter legally privileged material in the investigation.

persons.name: Epsten
persons.context: The document concerns the review of electronic evidence related to him, with search terms provided by his attorneys before his suicide.

events.title: Email exchange on taint team search terms
events.description: An email is sent sharing the privilege search terms the taint team has been running on Epstein's electronic evidence, terms which were received from his attorneys before his suicide.

keyFacts: A taint team was actively reviewing Jeffrey Epstein's electronic evidence using privilege search terms as of March 2020.
The privilege search terms were provided by Epstein's attorneys before his death by suicide.
The email indicates coordination between the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) on evidence review.
The document is subject to a protective order, restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs.
